citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There is one container of a supplement in the kennel that is not suitable for use. The container, a supplement called
Vitalise, has an expiration date of 6/2019. The applicant reports the container is filled from a larger container and he forgot
to transcribe the expiration date onto the smaller container. When he checked the stock container, he found that it was
also expired. Expired or improperly labeled food additives can be dangerous as the efficacy, potency, and freshness
cannot be confirmed. If the supplements are spoiled or no longer effective, side effects to the supplement may become a
problem. Correct by ensuring that all supplements and food additives are properly labeled and not expired, so the
licensee is able to use the appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases. Corrected at the time of
the inspection.

The licensee is not following the Program of Vet Care for vaccinations. Of the 23 adult dogs, 3 are not up to date on all
three of the required vaccinations (distemper, parvovirus, and rabies). The current Program of Vet Care prescribes for the
vaccinations to be performed yearly.
- Adult female Shih Tzu #8757 has never been vaccinated against rabies. A rabies vaccination is due. The distemper and
parvovirus vaccines are current.
- Adult female Shih Tzu #8756 has never been vaccinated against rabies. A rabies vaccination is due. The distemper and
parvovirus vaccines are current.
- Adult female Shih Tzu #8759 has never been vaccinated against rabies. A rabies vaccination is due. The distemper and
parvovirus vaccines are current.
Rabies is a life-threatening disease and, if contracted, may cause pain, distress, and suffering. It is also important for
breeding females to be vaccinated as they will pass immunity to their offspring through their milk. Correct by vaccinating
for distemper, parvovirus, and rabies in accordance with a schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian and vaccine
manufacturer recommendations.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by October 6, 2023, or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
There is one container of a supplement in the kennel that is not suitable for use. The container, a supplement called 
Vitalise, has an expiration date of 6/2019. The applicant reports the container is filled from a larger container and he forgot 
to transcribe the expiration date onto the smaller container. When he checked the stock container, he found that it was 
also expired. Expired or improperly labeled food additives can be dangerous as the efficacy, potency, and freshness 
cannot be confirmed. If the supplements are spoiled or no longer effective, side effects to the supplement may become a 
problem. Correct by ensuring that all supplements and food additives are properly labeled and not expired, so the 
licensee is able to use the appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases. Corrected at the time of 
the inspection. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee is not following the Program of Vet Care for vaccinations. Of the 23 adult dogs, 3 are not up to date on all 
three of the required vaccinations (distemper, parvovirus, and rabies). The current Program of Vet Care prescribes for the 
vaccinations to be performed yearly. 
- Adult female Shih Tzu #8757 has never been vaccinated against rabies. A rabies vaccination is due. The distemper and 
parvovirus vaccines are current.  
- Adult female Shih Tzu #8756 has never been vaccinated against rabies. A rabies vaccination is due. The distemper and 
parvovirus vaccines are current. 
- Adult female Shih Tzu #8759 has never been vaccinated against rabies. A rabies vaccination is due. The distemper and 
parvovirus vaccines are current. 
 
Rabies is a life-threatening disease and, if contracted, may cause pain, distress, and suffering. It is also important for 
breeding females to be vaccinated as they will pass immunity to their offspring through their milk. Correct by vaccinating 
for distemper, parvovirus, and rabies in accordance with a schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian and vaccine 
manufacturer recommendations.

This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by October 6, 2023, or the applicant will forfeit the license 
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
